hanzi-su-wiki:
釣

Значения

Рыбачить; рыбалка; сдача (деньги)

Мнемоника

Металлический 金 крючок, который как ковш 勺 то опускают в воду, то вынимают обратно. Удить рыбу.

Варианты

钓
purpleculture_pinyin:
diào
to fish with a hook and bait
ловить рыбу на крючок и наживку

(Simplified: 钓)

purpleculture_examples:
釣魚 [ diào yú ]: to fish (with line and hook); to dupe
釣竿 [ diào gān ]: fishing rod; Classifiers: 根
釣鉤 [ diào gōu ]: fishhook
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿰ Left to right
    • 釒 [ jīn ] gold, metal; money
    • 勺 [ sháo ] spoon, ladle; unit of volume
heisig_chinese_memo: All the people that go to the Japanese festivals to go fishin' part time are suckers. Me? I'm a pro. I bring a big-ass golden ladle. I'm a true angling professional.
heisig_constituent: angling, metal, gold, ladle, bound up, drop
heisig_story: The character we learned for fishing (Frame 184) refers to the professional, net-casting industry, while the angling of this character refers to the sport. The odd thing is that your angling rod is a golden ladle which you are using to scoop goldfish out of a river.
koohiiStory1: All the people that go to the Japanese festivals to catch fish part time are suckers. Me? I´m a pro. I bring a big-ass golden ladle. I´m a true ANGLING professional.
koohiiStory2: Imagine an effeminate Roman 2000 years ago angling with a golden ladle instead of a rod because it matches his eyes and hair better and it impresses the boys. (Why a Roman? Because ´angling´ is just the roman-derived way to say ´fishing´ - use this to distinguish fishing from angling.).
jp_example_words:
釣り(つり): fishing, angling
釣鐘(つりがね): hanging bell
釣(つり): change (e.g. for a dollar)
釣(つり): fishing
釣り合う(つりあう): balance, be in harmony, suit
釣る(つる): to fish
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: A gold pool is where you're going to go fishing. Because, if the pool is gold, hopefully the fish are too.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Imagine yourself fishing in a gold pool, catching golden fish. What a great fishing spot this is.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: You caught a couple of gold fish. Two (つ) gold fish, actually!
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Count your golden fish. They're so nice! They're also worth their weight in gold, because, well, they are gold.
Ru_trainchinese: diào: (глаг) удить рыбу, рыбачить; (обр.) выуживать, гнаться за (напр., славой и богатством)
Kanshudo_mnemonic: you use a gold (金) ladle (勺) to go fishing with
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: The easiest way to go fishin is using a metal ladle to scoop the fish.  The only hard part is the angling.
humanum_full_description_en:
From the sound of " gold " and " spoon ", the original meaning is to obtain fish, shrimp and other aquatic animals with fishing tackle. "Shuowen": "Hook the fish. From the gold, the sound of the spoon." "Poetry‧Weifeng‧Bamboo Pole": "Yanyan bamboo pole, to catch Qi."

" Fishing " can mean a hook. "Huainanzi-Shuo Lin Xun": "You can't get fish without bait."

" Diao " also means to seek by means. Song Wang Anshi "Recalling the Poems of Yesterday to Show His Foreign Brothers": "Engraving chapters and sentences to present the emperor, catching Bo Lu Huan Ting Wei."

" Fishing " can also mean lure. "Huainanzi ‧ Zhushu Training": "Yu Jun is a treasure, and Jin offers bi and horse fishing."
humanum_short_description_en: From the sound of " gold " and " spoon ", the original meaning is to obtain fish, shrimp and other aquatic animals with fishing tackle.
humanum_full_description:
從「金」，「勺」聲，本義為以釣具獲取魚、蝦等水生動物。《說文》：「鉤魚也。从金，勺聲。」《詩‧衛風‧竹竿》：「籊籊竹竿，以釣于淇。」

　　「釣」可表示釣鉤。《淮南子‧說林訓》：「無餌之釣，不可以得魚。」

　　「釣」還表示以手段謀取。宋王安石〈憶昨詩示諸外弟〉：「刻章琢句獻天子，釣取薄祿歡庭闈。」

　　「釣」還可表示引誘。《淮南子‧主術訓》：「虞君好寶，而晉獻以璧、馬釣之。」
humanum_short_description: 從「金」，「勺」聲，本義為以釣具獲取魚、蝦等水生動物。

從「 金 」，「 勺 」聲，本義為以釣具獲取魚、蝦等水生動物。《說文》：「鉤魚也。从金，勺聲。」《詩‧衛風‧竹竿》：「籊籊竹竿，以釣于淇。」 「 釣 」可表示釣鉤。《淮南子‧說林訓》：「無餌之釣，不可以得魚。」 「 釣 」還表示以手段謀取。宋王安石〈憶昨詩示諸外弟〉：「刻章琢句獻天子，釣取薄祿歡庭闈。」 「 釣 」還可表示引誘。《淮南子‧主術訓》：「虞君好寶，而晉獻以璧、馬釣之。」
From the sound of " gold" and " spoon", the original meaning is to obtain fish, shrimp and other aquatic animals with fishing tackle. "Shuowen": "Hook the fish. From the gold, the sound of the spoon." "Poetry‧Weifeng‧Bamboo Pole": "Yanyan bamboo pole, to catch Qi." " Fishing" can mean a hook. "Huainanzi-Shuo Lin Xun": "You can't get fish without bait." " Diao" also means to seek by means. Song Wang Anshi "Recalling the Poems of Yesterday to Show His Foreign Brothers": "Engraving chapters and sentences to present the emperor, catching Bo Lu Huan Ting Wei." " Fishing" can also mean lure. "Huainanzi ‧ Zhushu Training": "Yu Jun is a treasure, and Jin offers bi and horse fishing."

釣字的基本解释

釣
diào
见“钓”。

釣字的汉语字典释义

[①]［diào］
［《廣韻》多嘯切，去嘯，端。］
“钓1”的繁体字。亦作“鈟1”。亦作“魡1”。
(1)以钓具获取水生动物。
(2)鱼钩。
(3)以手段谋取。
(4)引诱。
(5)八股文的一种作法。参见“釣伏渡挽”。
(6)用同“弔”。悬挂。

[①]［diào］
["Guangyun" more screams and cuts, go screams, end. ]
Traditional Chinese characters for "Diao 1". Also known as "鈟1". Also known as "魡1".
(1) Obtain aquatic animals with fishing tackle.
(2) Fish hook.
(3) Seek by means.
(4) Seduction.
(5) A method of eight-legged essay. See "Diao Fu Du Wan".
(6) Use the same "hanging". suspension.
